results.title: Atenolol treatment of paruresis.
results.text_hl: During @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ therapy, the client reported a decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Autonomic_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001342 @@@ANS symptoms@@@ but no increase in ability to urinate in public restrooms.

citations.NLM: Zgourides G. Atenolol treatment of paruresis. Psychol Rep. 1991 Jun;68(3 Pt 1):766. PMID: 1891538
citations.BibTeX: @article{1891538, title={Atenolol treatment of paruresis.}, author={Zgourides G}, journal={Psychol Rep}, volume={68}, number={3 Pt 1}, pages={766}}

results.title: Atenolol attenuates autonomic dysfunction of rat jejunum submitted to cold ischemic preservation.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ attenuates @<m>DISEASE_Autonomic_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001342 @@@autonomic dysfunction@@@ of @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ jejunum submitted to cold @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ preservation.

citations.NLM: Taha MO, Fraga MM, Guimarães FA, Jurkiewicz A, Caricati-Neto A. Atenolol attenuates autonomic dysfunction of rat jejunum submitted to cold ischemic preservation. Transplant Proc. 2006 Jul-Aug;38(6):1784-8. PMID: 16908280
citations.BibTeX: @article{16908280, title={Atenolol attenuates autonomic dysfunction of rat jejunum submitted to cold ischemic preservation.}, author={Taha MO and Fraga MM and Guimarães FA and Jurkiewicz A and Caricati-Neto A}, journal={Transplant Proc}, volume={38}, number={6}, pages={1784-8}}

results.title: Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our results demonstrate significant @DISEASE_Sleep_Deprivation @DISEASE_MESH:D012892 @@@sleep fragmentations@@@ with @DISEASE_Hyperkinesis @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@sympathetic hyperactivity@@@ during QS stages after MI, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ could restore the @<m>DISEASE_Autonomic_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001342 @@@autonomic dysfunction@@@ and @DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbance@@@.

citations.NLM: Lin WL, Lo LW, Chen HR, Lai CT, Yamada S, Liu SH, Chou YH, Chen SA, Fu YC, Kuo TB. Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction. Int J Cardiol. 2016 Dec 15;225():65-72. PMID: 27710806
citations.BibTeX: @article{27710806, title={Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction.}, author={Lin WL and Lo LW and Chen HR and Lai CT and Yamada S and Liu SH and Chou YH and Chen SA and Fu YC and Kuo TB}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={225}, pages={65-72}}

results.title: Mechanisms underlying very-low-frequency RR-interval oscillations in humans.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: We recorded RR intervals and arterial pressures during three separate sessions, with the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ in supine and 40 degree upright tilt positions, during 20-minute frequency (0.25 Hz) and tidal volume-controlled breathing after intravenous injections: saline (control), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (0.2 mg/kg, beta-adrenergic blockade), @CHEMICAL_Atropine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001285 @@@atropine sulfate@@@ (0.04 mg/kg, parasympathetic blockade), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atropine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001285 @@@atropine@@@ (complete @<m>DISEASE_Autonomic_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001342 @@@autonomic@@@ blockade), and @CHEMICAL_Enalaprilat @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015773 @@@enalaprilat@@@ (0.02 mg/kg, @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ blockade).

citations.NLM: Taylor JA, Carr DL, Myers CW, Eckberg DL. Mechanisms underlying very-low-frequency RR-interval oscillations in humans. Circulation. 1998 Aug 11;98(6):547-55. PMID: 9714112
citations.BibTeX: @article{9714112, title={Mechanisms underlying very-low-frequency RR-interval oscillations in humans.}, author={Taylor JA and Carr DL and Myers CW and Eckberg DL}, journal={Circulation}, volume={98}, number={6}, pages={547-55}}
